subject: Parenting
title: The Prefrontal Cortex Gap
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Prefrontal Cortex Gap.

hook.text: A teen knows texting while driving is dangerous. She does it anyway.

buildup.text: The prefrontal cortex manages judgment, planning, and impulse control.

discovery.text: In teens, this region communicates slowly with the emotional limbic system.

twist.text: They understand risk intellectually but can't override emotional impulses in the moment.

climax.text: This gap closes gradually through the twenties as myelination completes.

punchline.text: Knowing better and doing better use different circuits.

quiz.question: Why do teens often act impulsively despite knowing the risks?
options: Their prefrontal cortex can't override emotional impulses yet
